p: The H7N9 avian influenza subtype emerged in China in March 2013, and to date there has been no evidence of sustained human-to-human transmission. 108 In August 2018 the New York Times reported that China had been withholding samples of H7N9 influenza viruses from the U.S. CDC for more than a year. A separate report indicated that China was also withholding viruses from scientists in the UK. 109 This is the most recent viral sovereignty controversy, and it comes at a time when political tensions between China and the U.S. are ramping up.
